definition: to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]

sentences.english: Nevertheless the Kenite shall be wasted, until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.
sentences.chinese: 然而基尼必至衰微，直到亞述把你擄去。

sentences.english: The star power of British celebrities appears to be on the wane.
sentences.chinese: 英國明星的影響力似乎日漸衰微。

sentences.english: My heart pounds, my strength fails me; even the light has gone from my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我心跳動，我力衰微，連我眼中的光，也沒有了。

sentences.english: Simple analysis also the decaying Reason of Chaoshan songs.
sentences.chinese: 同時簡單分析潮汕歌謠日漸衰微的原因。

sentences.english: Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up to enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
sentences.chinese: 歲月悠悠，衰微之及肌膚，熱忱拋卻，頹廢必致靈魂。

sentences.english: The decline of a flower, flower lovers flower-loving people, is not particular, and the pain.
sentences.chinese: 一朵花的衰微，對愛花惜花人而言，是痛不尤及的。

sentences.english: The summit can, though, be opposed to decline as evil to good.
sentences.chinese: 雖然如此，顛峯能夠跟衰微對立，如同惡與善對立。

sentences.english: When his pulse failing, passion speechless lies.
sentences.chinese: 他的脈搏衰微，熱情安臥無語。

sentences.english: Learning from history that if the people of a nation loved their country , the country prospered ; otherwise it perished .
sentences.chinese: 歷史告訴我們，人民愛國，國便強盛，否則衰微。

sentences.english: yet you Kenites will be destroyed when Asshur takes you captive.
sentences.chinese: 然而基尼必至衰微，直到亞述把你擄去。

definition: to decline/to die out/decline and fall
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to deteriorate/to decline/to slump/also written 凌夷
(literary) to decline/to wane/title of a section in the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1]
to fall into disuse (of laws, customs etc)/to neglect
(of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
rites and music are in ruins (idiom); fig. society in total disarray/cf. 禮樂|礼乐[li3 yue4]
